question: Which of the following is true about the effect of altitude on the value of acceleration due to gravity?
option1: The acceleration due to gravity decreases with height
option2: The acceleration due to gravity increases with height
option3: The acceleration due to gravity is not dependent on height
answer: The acceleration due to gravity decreases with height
explanation: The acceleration due to gravity decreases with height. G<sub>0</sub>= g(1-2h/R) where h is the height above the surface of the earth.
